intro: Aulomyrcia pilantha var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf aulomyrcia, is a tropical plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green color. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within the Aulomyrcia genus.
